content: A translated version of the Bhagavad Gita in Savji dialect, an indigenous North Karnataka dialect, will be released in Hubballi on Wednesday

content: Ram Narayan‚Äôs brother Sasikanth Baghel urged the State government to move the High Court to seek cancellation of the bail, and also appoint a special public prosecutor to handle the case

content: So far, around 12 large boards mounted on two pillar-like structures have been installed, streaming continuous digital commercials. The Corporation has received numerous complaints about these boards, which are now under consideration by the Town Planning Committee

content: Delhi‚Äôs MCD-run Urdu-medium primary schools have seen dwindling student enrolment over a decade despite being located in highly populated areas whose residents speak the language. Suruchi Kumari finds that neglect is at the root of the state of education in these government-funded institutions

content: The deal, declared on January 30, has staved off further conflict between President Ahmed al-Sharaa's government and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces, which ‚Äãlost swathes of eastern and northern Syria ‚Å†to government troops in January.

content: Party will disclose the accounts at a press conference on February 6, following a directive from the State leadership to clear doubts among cadre

content: Through staff are working under immense pressure, abuse and attacks from the public have been increasing, says association

title: Bihar posts 13.1% growth in 2024-25, surpasses national average: economic survey
content: Despite the positive economic performance, Bihar continues to have the lowest per capita income in the country, says economist.

content: Committee president Zafar Ali, in a letter to the district magistrate on February 2, said a loudspeaker was required during Ramzan so that the Imam's voice could be clearly heard by the worshippers offering prayers at the mosque

title: Mysuru MP welcomes Union Budget, says it aims to realise ‚ÄòDeveloped India‚Äô
content: Hailing the budget as people-centric, Mysuru MP Wadiyar claimed the proposed COSMOS training centre to significantly benefit people in the region

content: ‚ÄúAll our examination process is confidential. We cannot reveal anything until a certificate is issued,‚Äù says CBFC Chennai Regional Officer D. Balamurali.

content: KPCC spokesperson M. Lakshman challenges the NCB to provide evidence of drug seizures at a phenyl manufacturing facility in Hebbal

title: Siddaramaiah trying to become leader of South India, says Vijayendra
content: The Chief Minister, in his reaction to the Union Budget, has tried to instigate the Southern states against the Centre, says the State BJP president

title: 'Defect in fuel switch': Air India pilot flags issue with Boeing 787-8; plane grounded
content: Air India has grounded a Boeing 787 Dreamliner after its crew reported a fuel control switch issue post-landing. This follows a 2025 crash where a similar switch malfunction led to engine failure. The airline is investigating with the manufacturer, while aviation regulators are also probing the incident, raising safety concerns.

title: 'Wangchuk tried to provoke Gen Z': Centre's 'Nepal-Bangladesh' charge in SC
content: Environmental activist Sonam Wangchuk, detained under NSA, is accused by the Centre of inciting Ladakh's youth for protests inspired by regime-toppling movements. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court that Wangchuk's speeches, referencing Nepal, Bangladesh, and the Arab Spring, aimed to create a rift between the people and the government. The court is hearing a challenge to his detention.

title: EXPLAINED: How much will an India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup no-show cost?
content: Pakistan's boycott of the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match is projected to cause a massive financial loss of USD 250 million. This decision risks significant revenue for all stakeholders, including the ICC and India's broadcaster, JioStar, which faces estimated advertising losses of Rs 200-250 crore.

title: As Amazon lays off 16000, AWS VP Greg Pearson tells employees: Continue using ...
content: Amazon has axed 16,000 corporate jobs, its second-largest layoff in months. Leadership is urging remaining staff to leverage technology for efficiency and support one another. This move aligns with CEO Andy Jassy's vision of AI driving future workforce changes and streamlining operations, while the company continues to invest in strategic areas.

title: 'Arrogant, liar': Mamata flays EC chief over SIR; warns can bring 'lakhs of people to Delhi'
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee hit out at CEC Gyanesh Kumar and called him 'arrogant' and 'liar' post meeting. The remarks came amid the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal. Banerjee and her party Trinamool Congress have called the exercise as biased, discriminatory and politically motivated.

title: From supersonic to hypersonic - BrahMos enters next phase of evolution
content: India and Russia are continuously upgrading the BrahMos cruise missile, with a strong focus now on developing hypersonic technologies. This ongoing enhancement aims to improve performance and introduce next-generation variants, including smaller missiles and hypersonic platforms. The collaboration underscores a commitment to advanced missile development for future warfare.

title: Dhurandhar's warning: Why Balochistan is on edge again - what it means for Pakistan
content: Pakistan faces a deepening security crisis in Balochistan as the Baloch Liberation Army escalates its campaign through "Operation Herof. This surge impacts Pakistan's economy, foreign relations, and investor confidence. The region's strategic importance, particularly for China's Belt and Road Initiative and mineral resources, is now under strain.

title: Oracle may layoff up to 30,000; one of the reasons is firm's 'commitment'
content: Oracle faces potential job cuts of 20,000-30,000 to fund its massive $156 billion OpenAI partnership. The company has already incurred significant debt for data centers, and rising borrowing costs are stalling projects. OpenAI is reportedly shifting some capacity to Microsoft and Amazon, raising concerns about Oracle's delivery capabilities.

title: ‚ÄòNot trying to defame Army‚Äô: Priyanka defends Rahul amid LS standoff over Naravane memoir
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra defended her brother, Rahul Gandhi, stating he quoted from a magazine referencing former Army Chief Naravane's memoir, not defaming the Army. The Lok Sabha saw disruptions and adjournment as Gandhi insisted on discussing border tensions, prompting objections from BJP members who accused him of flouting rules and demoralizing forces. Gandhi maintained national security is paramount.

title: 'Players are on board with ... ': Pakistan captain's first comments before leaving for Sri Lanka
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha confirmed players will follow government and cricket board directives regarding the boycott of the T20 World Cup clash against India. The team manager informed players of the decision, with former captains publicly backing the move. Pakistan's squad departed for Sri Lanka to compete in their remaining matches.

title: Tesla's former Al Director posts long note about Moltbook, Elon Musk responds
content: Elon Musk reacted to Andrej Karpathy's observations on Moltbook, an AI agent platform, calling it an early stage of the technological singularity. Karpathy described the platform as a sci-fi takeoff-adjacent phenomenon where AI bots self-organize and interact autonomously, despite acknowledging its current chaotic nature and security risks.

title: Donna Kelce reacts sweetly to Taylor Swift and Kylie Kelce joining the family
content: Donna Kelce shared a heartfelt reaction to Taylor Swift and Kylie Kelce becoming part of the Kelce family. In response to a fan, she wrote on Facebook how she feels lucky that her sons choose and bring in women who are the best in society.

title: Amaal Mallik reveals why he chose Sonu Nigam over Arijit Singh for Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3
content: Composer Amaal Mallik faced significant pushback for casting Sonu Nigam in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3's 'Mere Dholna 3.0'. Despite doubts from marketing and actor's teams, Mallik insisted, believing Nigam's classical prowess was essential. Nigam's swift, masterful recording of the challenging track ultimately silenced critics, proving Mallik's vision correct.

title: Top 10 stocks to buy post Budget 2026
content: Budget 2026 stock market picks: Motilal Oswal Financial Services shares its top 10 stock picks that investors can consider buying. Here‚Äôs what the brokerage has to say:

title: Ex-ICC official accuses BCCI of mishandling Mustafizur Rahman exit, fueling T20 World Cup row
content: Former ICC official Sami-ul-Hasan Burney criticised the BCCI's public handling of Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit, suggesting it triggered Bangladesh's withdrawal and Pakistan's forfeited match. Burney also highlighted PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi's view of the ICC's stance on match venue changes as "shifting of goalposts."

title: 'Can't India-China ties be discussed?' Mahua Moitra on Parl ruckus over Rahul's remark
content: TMC MP Mahua Moitra criticised the Centre for labeling the Opposition as unpatriotic and restricting discussions on crucial foreign relations. The Parliament Budget Session saw heated exchanges when Rahul Gandhi attempted to quote from former Army Chief Naravane's unpublished memoir, which was disallowed by the Lok Sabha Speaker, escalating tensions.

title: John Harbaugh says he tried to stop Todd Monken from joining the Browns
content: The Cleveland Browns have hired Todd Monken as their new head coach, securing an offensive mind after a tense search.  John Harbaugh admitted he tried to keep Monken, highlighting the close call.  Monken's proven offensive success with the Ravens offers optimism for the Browns' future, especially with quarterback Shedeur Sanders.

title: ISL: FanCode awarded broadcast rights; KP Studios bag production rights
content: FanCode has been awarded the broadcast rights for the upcoming 2025-26 ISL season with KPS Studios bagging the production rights. A total of seven parties had shown interest. FanCode's overall bid of Rs 8.62 covers linear TV and digital streaming broadcasts. The truncated season gets underway on February 14 - after a five month delay.

title: 'Can't be any sanctions': Ex-PCB chief on why ICC can't punish Pakistan
content: Former Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chairman Ehsan Mani says the ICC cannot sanction Pakistan for skipping the India match, as the PCB is following government orders. He cites India‚Äôs earlier refusal to tour Pakistan without punishment. Mani blames the ICC for inaction and warns Pakistan could face revenue losses and sporting consequences.

title: Ariana Mukherjee sparks buzz with Mahima Chaudhry at low-key Mumbai outing
content: At a recent event in Mumbai, Mahima Chaudhry and her daughter Ariana Mukherjee showcased a charming blend of elegance and poise. Their effortless interaction with photographers during the launch of Variety Magazine India caught the attention of many, with audiences lauding Ariana's fresh demeanor and striking resemblance to her mother.

title: Graduate employability in India: Why Tier-1 colleges win bigger in non-tech jobs
content: A tier-wise snapshot from Mercer | Mettl‚Äôs India‚Äôs Graduate Skill Index 2025 shows Tier-1 colleges lead overall employability. But the gap doesn‚Äôt behave the same across roles. Technical employability is relatively close across tiers. Non-tech roles widen the spread. That suggests hiring rewards workplace-ready performance‚Äîwriting, presentation, judgement‚Äîoften shaped by campus exposure. For colleges, the message for colleges is that build this training into daily teaching and assessment, not as a last-minute add-on.

title: Congress vs Tharoor: A new beginning or temporary truce?
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has affirmed his commitment to the party and will actively campaign for the UDF in Kerala's upcoming assembly elections. Following a meeting with party leaders, Tharoor stated that differences were exaggerated and all are now on the same page. The Kerala Congress has also confirmed his prominent role in the election campaign.

title: As Travis Kelce‚Äôs NFL future remains uncertain, Taylor Swift makes history
content: Taylor Swift reached another major milestone as Billboard ranked her second all time in Hot 100 hits with 276 entries, the most by any woman. The achievement surfaced as Grammy events unfolded. Meanwhile, Travis Kelce faces uncertainty over his NFL future, with retirement still undecided, even as renewed ties with Chiefs coach Eric Bieniemy hint at a possible return season.

title: 'If Pakistan meet India in final, will they hand over the trophy?': Pak slammed by their ex-player
content: Former Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria criticises the decision to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India, stating it projects fear and harms Pakistan cricket. He argues the move, especially with the match shifted to Sri Lanka, lacks logic and complicates their path to the knockouts.

title: Rahul vs Shah, Rajnath: Parliament showdown over Naravane memoir ‚Äî how it unfolded
content: Lok Sabha witnessed a heated exchange as Rahul Gandhi quoted from former Army chief General MM Naravane's unpublished memoir during the Motion of Thanks. Union ministers Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh objected, citing parliamentary rules against citing unpublished material. Gandhi defended his reference, stating it pertained to the Prime Minister's character.

title: Pakistan boycotts India T20 World Cup clash: Why teams skipped selective ICC matches before
content: Cricket faces another boycott controversy as Pakistan refuses to play India in the T20 World Cup 2026 on February 15. This echoes past incidents like the 1996 and 2003 World Cups, where teams forfeited matches due to security and political reasons. The ICC deems selective participation unacceptable, warning of consequences for Pakistan.

title: 'No money, no honey': Yuzvendra Chahal's latest social media post goes viral
content: Indian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal went viral after sharing Thailand vacation photos with the caption ‚ÄúNo Money, No Honey.‚Äù The post drew widespread attention. Amid ongoing dating rumours, actress Shefali Bagga slammed trolls over AI-generated posters linking her with Chahal, calling them ‚Äúdisgusting.‚Äù Chahal also reacted sarcastically. His personal life continues to fuel online buzz.

title: Fact check: Was Drake Maye accused of cheating on wife before Super Bowl?
content: Drake Maye and his wife, Ann Michael Maye, are the new fan favorites after their love story inspired billions around the world. The two have hardly been married for a year as many are now speculating that the star player has allegedly cheated on his newly wed wife. This originated after a few pictures went viral and here's all about the truth behind it.

title: Musk said he rebuffed Epstein. The emails tell a different story...
content: Between late 2012 and the end of 2013, Musk and Epstein exchanged multiple emails discussing island visits, parties, schedules, and logistics. Some plans fell through. Others were cancelled. But the emails show Musk actively engaging in conversations about going.

title: Valentine‚Äôs week calendar: Complete list of special days with romantic wishes & more
content: February ushers in Valentine's Week, a prelude to Valentine's Day on the 14th. Starting February 7th, each day offers a unique way to express love, from Rose Day to Kiss Day. This tradition, rooted in history and celebrating connections, culminates in a day dedicated to heartfelt gestures and cherished memories.

title: 3,500-year-old rhino bone fragments found in Western Ghats rewrite India‚Äôs wildlife map
content: Archaeological findings of rhino bones near Coimbatore reveal the species once roamed southern India, significantly expanding its known ancient range. This discovery contrasts with current conservation data showing the one-horned rhinoceros is now confined to specific regions in Northeast India and West Bengal, where populations are steadily increasing due to dedicated conservation efforts.

title: Australian Open: At the Happy Slam, not everyone was happy
content: In 2007, Roger Federer coined the term "Happy Slam" to describe the Australian Open - the first Grand Slam on the tennis calendar. 19 years later, he was back in Melbourne and explained the 'why' behind it. As three weeks of record attendance concluded, not everyone was quite 'happy' with how things turned out.

title: 'Cricket can open doors': Shahid Afridi's surprising post on Pakistan's India boycott
content: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi expressed regret over Pakistan's government decision to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India, stating he stands behind the government. This stance contrasts with his past remarks on keeping sports and politics separate, drawing criticism for seemingly supporting political interference in a major tournament.

title: Travis Kelce steps back from drama and retirement rumours as Swift wedding stalls
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's wedding have the whole world waiting but now, there are rumors of their wedding being reportedly delayed as the two deal with retirement rumors. Amid all this, it seems the star player is now taking a break from his regular life as he is all set to make a rare appearance in Arizona, possibly without Taylor Swift.

title: Sheikh Hasina convicted again: B'desh court hands 10-yr sentence in housing scam cases
content: A Bangladesh court has handed former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina a 10-year prison sentence in two corruption cases concerning plot allocations. Her niece, British MP Tulip Siddiq, received a four-year sentence.  The convictions stem from alleged irregularities in the Purbachal New Town project.  Hasina, living in exile, faces multiple other convictions.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in your city today? Check rates
content: Precious metals experienced intense selling pressure on Monday, with gold and silver hitting lower circuit limits on the MCX due to aggressive profit-booking. Gold prices slumped 6%, while silver saw a sharper 12% correction, extending recent losses after a strong rally.

title: Video: 11 injured as SUV ploughs into crowd during festival rush; driver thrashed
content: A shocking incident unfolded on Sangli's Tilak Road as an SUV driver, Praniket Dattatrey Panchal, mowed down multiple vehicles and a crowd gathered for the Krushnamai Festival.  The driver was assaulted by locals before police intervention.  Eleven people, including five officers, sustained injuries, many with fractures, and were hospitalized.  A case has been filed.

title: ‚ÄòNothing but drama‚Äô: Harbhajan Singh slams Pakistan's T20 World Cup boycott of India clash
content: Harbhajan Singh slammed Pakistan's decision to boycott their T20 World Cup match against India as "unnecessary drama." He questioned the logic behind the conditional approval, suggesting it's a ploy to mislead people and project solidarity with Bangladesh. Singh highlighted the ICC's rejection of Bangladesh's request and Pakistan's past revenue-driven approach to matches despite political tensions.

title: 'Restrain yourself from atrocities': Mamata vs Delhi Police ahead of CEC meet over SIR
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee arrived in Delhi for a meeting with the Election Commission amid political tension. She protested a heavy police presence outside Banga Bhavan, comparing the treatment to that of Union home minister Amit Shah's visits to West Bengal. Banerjee vowed to fight against alleged atrocities and harassment of people from Bengal.

title: What is ‚ÄòX spot‚Äô? Delhi runner's death near finish line at Indore marathon raises concerns
content: A 24-year-old Delhi-based runner, Aryan Todi, tragically collapsed and died just 100 meters from the finish line of a 21 km marathon in Indore. Despite immediate CPR and hospital efforts, doctors confirmed his death, with preliminary indications pointing to cardiac arrest during the high-risk "X spot" phase of the race.

title: Air India Ahmedabad Crash And Fuel Switch Controversy That Followed
content: An Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner operating flight AI132 from London to Bengaluru was grounded after a pilot reported that the left engine's fuel control switch failed to remain in the "RUN" position during engine start-up, twice moving to "CUTOFF

title: 2 Tigers Electrocuted In Madhya Pradesh, 9 Big Cat Deaths Reported In 2026
content: A tiger and a tigress died of electrocution in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district on Monday, taking the death toll of big cats in the state this year to nine, an official said.

title: Air India Dreamliner Grounded After Fuel Switch Moves From 'Run' To 'Cutoff'
content: An Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner was grounded after its left fuel control switch failed to stay in the 'run' position twice and moved to 'cutoff' during engine startup, an airline spokesperson said. The flight number was AI 132.

title: TVK Is The Top Engine: Vijay Takes Dig At DMK And BJP, Downplays AIADMK
content: Celebrating the third anniversary of Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK), party chief Vijay took a veiled dig at both the BJP and the DMK, saying "Dappa Engine" and "Repair Engine" cannot match TVK's "Top Engine."

title: Mamata Banerjee Calls Poll Chief "Liar", Sources Say She Banged Table
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has brought the SIR battle to the national capital. After meeting Election Commission officials today, she gave an open threat: "I can get lakhs of people to Delhi to parade before the Election Commission."

title: Parliament Budget Session 2026¬†Highlights: Rahul Gandhi Raises Ladakh Stand-Off In Lok Sabha, Rajnath Singh Intervenes
content: Budget Session of Parliament¬†2026 Highlights: Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi today spoke during discussion on Motion of Thanks on the President's Address, a day after finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman presented her ninth Union Budget

title: Iran President Orders Nuclear Talks With US As Trump Hopeful Of Deal
content: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has ordered the start of nuclear talks with the United States, local media said Monday, after US leader Donald Trump said he was hopeful of a deal to avert military action against the Islamic Republic.

title: In Shashi Tharoor's Vocal Support Of Rahul Gandhi, Signs Of Growing Closeness
content: When Rahul Gandhi rose to speak in the Lok Sabha, holding up a printed magazine article referring to an unpublished memoir by former Army chief General MM Naravane, it escalated into a full-blown parliamentary confrontation, then an adjournment.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Budget 2026: No More 'Instant Gratification'
content: Enhancing the Indian economy to realise the audacious ambition of becoming a developed economy in the next 21 years entails unglamorous work.

title: Scientists Solve Mystery Of Puzzling Radio Pulses From Space
content: Cosmic radio pulses repeating every few minutes or hours, known as long-period transients, have puzzled astronomers since their discovery in 2022. Our new study, published in Nature Astronomy today, might finally add some clarity.

title: Man Slits Woman's Throat In Dehradun, Arrested: Cops
content: A woman was allegedly murdered in broad daylight after a man slit her throat with a sharp weapon here on Monday, police said.

title: Before Real Estate Tycoon CJ Roy's Suicide, Petition Against Tax Raids, Then 'U-Turn'
content: Days after realtor and businessman CJ Roy was found dead in his Bengaluru office, questions persist regarding the circumstances that led him to take such an extreme step.

title: Father, Compounder, Help: 3 Men At Centre Of Jodhpur Sadhvi's Death Probe
content: The investigation into the death of 25-year-old religious preacher Sadhvi Prem Baisa in Rajasthan has narrowed down to three men whose presence at her ashram on the evening of January 28 is now central to the police inquiry.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Real Reason Mamata Has Taken The SIR Fight To Delhi
content: Mamata plans to turn the SIR controversy to the Trinamool's advantage as she prepares to contest for a fourth term as Chief Minister.

title: Supreme Court Bail For Akali's Bikram Majithia A Setback For AAP
content: The Supreme Court granting bail to Shiromani Akali Dal leader Bikram Singh Majithia in the disproportionate assets (DA) case marks a clear political setback for the ruling Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in Punjab.

title: Gaza's Rafah Crossing Reopens With Limited Access, No Goods To Pass Through
content: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopened on Monday for limited traffic, a key step in the Israel-Hamas ceasefire but a mostly symbolic development on the ground as few people will be allowed to travel in either direction.

title: 70-Year-Old Woman Run Over By Train In UP: Cops
content: A 70-year-old woman died after being hit by a train on a rail bridge in Jamui Bazaar area here on Monday, police said.

title: Unrest In Andhra Over Remarks On C Naidu, 2 Opposition Leaders Targetted
content: Political tension has escalated in Andhra Pradesh as the supporters of the ruling Telugu Desam Party or TDP allegedly attacked the residences of senior YSR Congress Party or YSRCP leaders over the weekend.

title: Night Raids, Mutilated Bodies: Baloch Group Reports Deepening Rights Crisis
content: A new human rights report released by Paank, the human rights department of the Baloch National Movement (BNM), paints a grim and disturbing picture of life in Balochistan during December 2025.

title: Reigns, Morgan could face new opponents at Wrestle...
content: roman Reigns and Liv Morgan are the winners of the men's and women's royal Rumble matches . he can challenge for the championship of his choice, and he'll face an important decision . it's time to look ahead to the biggest superstars in the world on the road to Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas between now and April .

title: Super Bowl-bound Patriots follow in Mack Hollins' ...
content: a glass drops and shatters in the new England Patriots' cafeteria . a record scratch might as well ring out from the amps on the nearby practice field . Mack Hollins hasn't consistently worn shoes in the past decade .

title: Shaun White's next act? Revolutionizing snowboardi...
content: SHAUN WHITE, 39, has seen himself in a snowboard bib since he last competed at the 2022 Beijing winter Olympics . he will take a ceremonial run through the Buttermilk Mountain halfpipe to open the March 2025 contest that has brought him to town .

title: Stick with Carrick or hire another coach? Man Unit...
content: the "caretaker" is starting to back the club into a corner . the club have a window in which to decide who, why and when in terms of identifying and hiring their No. 1 candidate as permanent head coach . but the ideal scenario for United would be to wait until the end of the season and assess their options, possibly based on whether they finish in the top four or neither .

title: What did he say? Why millions are riding on the words of the Super Bowl announcers
content: the average amount risked on NFL announcer mention markets has grown more than seven times . since September, the average risk on the market has grown from less than half a million per game at the start of the season to $3.55 million on the AFC and NFC championship games .
